an8.118:1.1.eng: “For insight into greed, eight things should be developed.

an8.118:1.3.pli: Sammādiṭṭhi, sammāsaṅkappo, sammāvācā, sammākammanto, sammāājīvo, sammāvāyāmo, sammāsati, sammāsamādhi—
an8.118:1.3.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

an8.118:1.4.pli: rāgassa, bhikkhave, abhiññāya ime aṭṭha dhammā bhāvetabbā”ti.
an8.118:1.4.eng: For insight into greed, these eight things should be developed.”

an8.119:1.1.eng: “For insight into greed, eight things should be developed.

an8.119:1.3.pli: Ajjhattaṃ rūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni,
an8.119:1.3.eng: Perceiving form internally, they see forms externally, limited, both pretty and ugly.

an8.119:1.4.eng: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

an8.119:1.5.pli: Ajjhattaṃ rūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, tāni abhibhuyya ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṃsaññī hoti.
an8.119:1.5.eng: Perceiving form internally, they see forms externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly. …

an8.119:1.6.pli: Ajjhattaṃ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, tāni abhibhuyya ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṃsaññī hoti.
an8.119:1.6.eng: Not perceiving form internally, they see forms externally, limited, both pretty and ugly. …

an8.119:1.7.pli: Ajjhattaṃ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, tāni abhibhuyya ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṃsaññī hoti.
an8.119:1.7.eng: Not perceiving form internally, they see forms externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly. …

an8.119:1.8.pli: Ajjhattaṃ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati nīlāni nīlavaṇṇāni nīlanidassanāni nīlanibhāsāni
an8.119:1.8.eng: Not perceiving form internally, they see forms externally, blue, with blue color and blue appearance. …

an8.119:1.11.eng: Not perceiving form internally, they see forms externally, white, with white color and white appearance.

an8.119:1.12.eng: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

an8.119:1.13.pli: rāgassa, bhikkhave, abhiññāya ime aṭṭha dhammā bhāvetabbā”.
an8.119:1.13.eng: For insight into greed, these eight things should be developed.”

an8.12:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
an8.12:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

an8.12:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī santhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā anekapariyāyena buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.
an8.12:1.2.eng: Now at that time several very prominent Licchavis were sitting together at the town hall, praising the Buddha, his teaching, and the Saṅgha in many ways.

an8.12:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sīho senāpati nigaṇṭhasāvako tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti.
an8.12:2.1.eng: Now at that time General Sīha, a disciple of the Jains, was sitting in that assembly.

an8.12:2.3.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho bhavissati, tathā hime sambahulā abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī santhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā anekapariyāyena buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.
an8.12:2.3.eng: “That Blessed One must without a doubt be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha. For several very prominent Licchavis are praising the Buddha, his teaching, and the Saṅgha in many ways.

an8.12:2.4.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkameyyaṃ arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhan”ti.
an8.12:2.4.eng: Why don’t I go to see that Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!”

an8.12:2.5.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati yena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā nigaṇṭhaṃ nāṭaputtaṃ etadavoca:
an8.12:2.5.eng: Then General Sīha went to the Jain ascetic of the Ñātika clan and said to him,

an8.12:2.6.eng: “Sir, I’d like to go to see the ascetic Gotama.”

an8.12:3.1.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, sīha, kiriyavādo samāno akiriyavādaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamissasi?
an8.12:3.1.eng: “But Sīha, you believe in the doctrine of action. Why should you go to see the ascetic Gotama, who teaches a doctrine of inaction?

an8.12:3.2.pli: Samaṇo hi, sīha, gotamo akiriyavādo, akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī”ti.
an8.12:3.2.eng: For the ascetic Gotama believes in a doctrine of inaction, he teaches inaction, and he guides his disciples in that way.”

an8.12:3.3.pli: Atha kho sīhassa senāpatissa yo ahosi gamiyābhisaṅkhāro bhagavantaṃ dassanāya, so paṭippassambhi.
an8.12:3.3.eng: Then Sīha’s determination to go and see the Buddha died down.

an8.12:4.1.pli: Dutiyampi kho sambahulā abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī santhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā anekapariyāyena buddhassa …pe… dhammassa …pe… saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.
an8.12:4.1.eng: For a second time, several prominent Licchavis were sitting together at the town hall, praising the Buddha, his teaching, and the Saṅgha in many ways.

an8.12:4.2.eng: And for a second time Sīha thought:

an8.12:4.3.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho bhavissati, tathā hime sambahulā abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī santhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā anekapariyāyena buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, dhammassa …pe… saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.

an8.12:4.4.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkameyyaṃ arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhan”ti.
an8.12:4.4.eng: “Why don’t I go to see that Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!”

an8.12:4.5.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati yena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā nigaṇṭhaṃ nāṭaputtaṃ etadavoca:
an8.12:4.5.eng: Then General Sīha went to the Jain Ñātika …

an8.12:5.1.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, sīha, kiriyavādo samāno akiriyavādaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamissasi?

an8.12:5.2.pli: Samaṇo hi, sīha, gotamo akiriyavādo akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī”ti.

an8.12:5.3.pli: Dutiyampi kho sīhassa senāpatissa yo ahosi gamiyābhisaṅkhāro bhagavantaṃ dassanāya, so paṭippassambhi.
an8.12:5.3.eng: Then for a second time Sīha’s determination to go and see the Buddha died down.

an8.12:6.1.pli: Tatiyampi kho sambahulā abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī santhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā anekapariyāyena buddhassa …pe… dhammassa …pe… saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.
an8.12:6.1.eng: For a third time, several prominent Licchavis were sitting together at the town hall, praising the Buddha, his teaching, and the Saṅgha in many ways.

an8.12:6.2.eng: And for a third time Sīha thought,

an8.12:6.3.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho bhavissati, tathā hime sambahulā abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī santhāgāre sannisinnā sannipatitā anekapariyāyena buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti, saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.
an8.12:6.3.eng: “That Blessed One must without a doubt be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha. For several very prominent Licchavis are praising the Buddha, his teaching, and the Saṅgha in many ways.

an8.12:6.4.pli: Kiṃ hime karissanti nigaṇṭhā apalokitā vā anapalokitā vā?
an8.12:6.4.eng: What can these Jains do to me, whether I take leave of them or not?

an8.12:6.5.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ anapaloketvāva nigaṇṭhe taṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkameyyaṃ arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhan”ti.
an8.12:6.5.eng: Why don’t I, without taking leave of them, go to see that Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!”

an8.12:7.1.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati pañcamattehi rathasatehi divādivassa vesāliyā niyyāsi bhagavantaṃ dassanāya.
an8.12:7.1.eng: Then Sīha, with around five hundred chariots, set out from Vesālī in the middle of the day to see the Buddha.

an8.12:7.2.pli: Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikova agamāsi.
an8.12:7.2.eng: He went by carriage as far as the terrain allowed, then descended and went by foot.

an8.12:7.3.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho sīho senāpati bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an8.12:7.3.eng: Then General Sīha went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

an8.12:8.2.pli: ‘akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.
an8.12:8.2.eng: ‘The ascetic Gotama believes in a doctrine of inaction, he teaches inaction, and he guides his disciples in that way.’

an8.12:8.3.pli: Ye te, bhante, evamāhaṃsu: ‘akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti, kacci te, bhante, bhagavato vuttavādino na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkhanti dhammassa cānudhammaṃ byākaronti na ca koci sahadhammiko vādānuvādo gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgacchati?
an8.12:8.3.eng: I trust those who say this repeat what the Buddha has said, and do not misrepresent him with an untruth? Is their explanation in line with the teaching? Are there any legitimate grounds for rebuttal and criticism?

an8.12:8.4.eng: For we don’t want to misrepresent the Blessed One.”

an8.12:9.1.pli: “Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:9.1.eng: “There is, Sīha, a sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:9.2.pli: ‘akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.
an8.12:9.2.eng: I believe in inaction, I teach inaction, and I guide my disciples in that way.

an8.12:10.1.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:10.1.eng: And there is a sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:10.2.pli: ‘kiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, kiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.
an8.12:10.2.eng: I believe in action, I teach action, and I guide my disciples in that way.

an8.12:11.1.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:11.1.eng: And there is a sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:11.2.pli: ‘ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo, ucchedāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.
an8.12:11.2.eng: I believe in annihilationism, I teach annihilation, and I guide my disciples in that way.

an8.12:12.1.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:12.1.eng: And there is a sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:12.2.pli: ‘jegucchī samaṇo gotamo, jegucchitāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.
an8.12:12.2.eng: I’m disgusted, I teach disgust, and I guide my disciples in that way.

an8.12:13.1.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:13.1.eng: And there is a sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:13.2.pli: ‘venayiko samaṇo gotamo, vinayāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.
an8.12:13.2.eng: I’m an exterminator, I teach extermination, and I guide my disciples in that way.

an8.12:14.1.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:14.1.eng: And there is a sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:14.2.pli: ‘tapassī samaṇo gotamo, tapassitāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.
an8.12:14.2.eng: I’m a mortifier, I teach mortification, and I guide my disciples in that way.

an8.12:15.1.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:15.1.eng: And there is a sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:15.2.pli: ‘apagabbho samaṇo gotamo, apagabbhatāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.
an8.12:15.2.eng: I’m immature, I teach immaturity, and I guide my disciples in that way.

an8.12:16.1.pli: Atthi, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:16.1.eng: And there is a sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:16.2.pli: ‘assāsako samaṇo gotamo, assāsāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.
an8.12:16.2.eng: I’m ambitious, I teach ambition, and I guide my disciples in that way.

an8.12:17.1.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:17.1.eng: And what’s the sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:17.2.pli: ‘akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti?
an8.12:17.2.eng: I believe in inaction, I teach inaction, and I guide my disciples in that way?

an8.12:17.3.pli: Ahañhi, sīha, akiriyaṃ vadāmi kāyaduccaritassa vacīduccaritassa manoduccaritassa;
an8.12:17.3.eng: I teach inaction regarding bad bodily, verbal, and mental conduct,

an8.12:17.4.pli: anekavihitānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ akiriyaṃ vadāmi.
an8.12:17.4.eng: and the many kinds of unskillful things.

an8.12:17.5.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:17.5.eng: In this sense you could rightly say that I teach inaction.

an8.12:17.6.pli: ‘akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, akiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.

an8.12:18.1.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:18.1.eng: And what’s the sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:18.2.pli: ‘kiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, kiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti?
an8.12:18.2.eng: I believe in action, I teach action, and I guide my disciples in that way?

an8.12:18.3.pli: Ahañhi, sīha, kiriyaṃ vadāmi kāyasucaritassa vacīsucaritassa manosucaritassa;
an8.12:18.3.eng: I teach action regarding good bodily, verbal, and mental conduct,

an8.12:18.4.eng: and the many kinds of skillful things.

an8.12:18.5.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:18.5.eng: In this sense you could rightly say that I teach action.

an8.12:18.6.pli: ‘kiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, kiriyāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.

an8.12:19.1.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:19.1.eng: And what’s the sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:19.2.pli: ‘ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo, ucchedāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti?
an8.12:19.2.eng: I believe in annihilationism, I teach annihilation, and I guide my disciples in that way?

an8.12:19.3.pli: Ahañhi, sīha, ucchedaṃ vadāmi rāgassa dosassa mohassa;
an8.12:19.3.eng: I teach the annihilation of greed, hate, and delusion,

an8.12:19.4.pli: anekavihitānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ucchedaṃ vadāmi.
an8.12:19.4.eng: and the many kinds of unskillful things.

an8.12:19.5.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:19.5.eng: In this sense you could rightly say that I teach annihilationism.

an8.12:19.6.pli: ‘ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo, ucchedāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.

an8.12:20.1.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:20.1.eng: And what’s the sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:20.2.pli: ‘jegucchī samaṇo gotamo, jegucchitāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti?
an8.12:20.2.eng: I’m disgusted, I teach disgust, and I guide my disciples in that way?

an8.12:20.3.pli: Ahañhi, sīha, jigucchāmi kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena;
an8.12:20.3.eng: I’m disgusted by bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind,

an8.12:20.4.pli: jigucchāmi anekavihitānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ samāpattiyā.
an8.12:20.4.eng: and by attainment of the many kinds of unskillful things.

an8.12:20.5.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:20.5.eng: In this sense you could rightly say that I’m disgusted.

an8.12:20.6.pli: ‘jegucchī samaṇo gotamo, jegucchitāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.

an8.12:21.1.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:21.1.eng: And what’s the sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:21.2.pli: ‘venayiko samaṇo gotamo, vinayāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti?
an8.12:21.2.eng: I’m an exterminator, I teach extermination, and I guide my disciples in that way?

an8.12:21.3.pli: Ahañhi, sīha, vinayāya dhammaṃ desemi rāgassa dosassa mohassa;
an8.12:21.3.eng: I teach the extermination of greed, hate, and delusion,

an8.12:21.4.pli: anekavihitānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ vinayāya dhammaṃ desemi.
an8.12:21.4.eng: and the many kinds of unskillful things.

an8.12:21.5.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:21.5.eng: In this sense you could rightly say that I’m an exterminator.

an8.12:21.6.pli: ‘venayiko samaṇo gotamo, vinayāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.

an8.12:22.1.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:22.1.eng: And what’s the sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:22.2.pli: ‘tapassī samaṇo gotamo, tapassitāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti?
an8.12:22.2.eng: I’m a mortifier, I teach mortification, and I guide my disciples in that way?

an8.12:22.3.pli: Tapanīyāhaṃ, sīha, pāpake akusale dhamme vadāmi kāyaduccaritaṃ vacīduccaritaṃ manoduccaritaṃ.
an8.12:22.3.eng: I say that bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind should be mortified.

an8.12:22.4.pli: Yassa kho, sīha, tapanīyā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā, tamahaṃ ‘tapassī’ti vadāmi.
an8.12:22.4.eng: I say that a mortifier is someone who has given up unskillful qualities that should be mortified. They’ve cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so that they’re unable to arise in the future.

an8.12:22.5.pli: Tathāgatassa kho, sīha, tapanīyā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.
an8.12:22.5.eng: The Realized One is someone who has given up unskillful qualities that should be mortified. He has cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so that they’re unable to arise in the future.

an8.12:22.6.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:22.6.eng: In this sense you could rightly say that I’m a mortifier.

an8.12:22.7.pli: ‘tapassī samaṇo gotamo, tapassitāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.

an8.12:23.1.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:23.1.eng: And what’s the sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:23.2.pli: ‘apagabbho samaṇo gotamo, apagabbhatāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti?
an8.12:23.2.eng: I’m immature, I teach immaturity, and I guide my disciples in that way?

an8.12:23.3.pli: Yassa kho, sīha, āyatiṃ gabbhaseyyā punabbhavābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā, tamahaṃ ‘apagabbho’ti vadāmi.
an8.12:23.3.eng: I say that an immature person is someone who has given up future wombs and regeneration into a new state of existence. They’ve cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so that they’re unable to arise in the future.

an8.12:23.4.pli: Tathāgatassa kho, sīha, āyatiṃ gabbhaseyyā punabbhavābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.
an8.12:23.4.eng: The Realized One has given up future wombs and regeneration into a new state of existence. He has cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so that they’re unable to arise in the future.

an8.12:23.5.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:23.5.eng: In this sense you could rightly say that I’m immature.

an8.12:23.6.pli: ‘apagabbho samaṇo gotamo, apagabbhatāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti.

an8.12:24.1.pli: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:24.1.eng: And what’s the sense in which you could rightly say that

an8.12:24.2.pli: ‘assāsako samaṇo gotamo, assāsāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’ti?
an8.12:24.2.eng: I’m ambitious, I teach ambition, and I guide my disciples in that way?

an8.12:24.3.pli: Ahañhi, sīha, assāsako paramena assāsena, assāsāya dhammaṃ desemi, tena ca sāvake vinemi.
an8.12:24.3.eng: I’m ambitious to offer solace, the highest solace, I teach solace, and I guide my disciples in that way.

an8.12:24.4.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṃ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
an8.12:24.4.eng: In this sense you could rightly say that I’m ambitious.”

an8.12:24.5.pli: ‘assāsako samaṇo gotamo, assāsāya dhammaṃ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī’”ti.

an8.12:25.1.pli: Evaṃ vutte, sīho senāpati bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an8.12:25.1.eng: When he said this, General Sīha said to the Buddha,

an8.12:25.3.pli: upāsakaṃ maṃ, bhante, bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
an8.12:25.3.eng: From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

an8.12:26.1.pli: “Anuviccakāraṃ kho, sīha, karohi. Anuviccakāro tumhādisānaṃ ñātamanussānaṃ sādhu hotī”ti.
an8.12:26.1.eng: “Sīha, you should act after careful consideration. It’s good for well-known people such as yourself to act after careful consideration.”

an8.12:26.2.pli: “Imināpāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato bhiyyoso mattāya attamano abhiraddho, yaṃ maṃ bhagavā evamāha: ‘anuviccakāraṃ kho, sīha, karohi. Anuviccakāro tumhādisānaṃ ñātamanussānaṃ sādhu hotī’ti.
an8.12:26.2.eng: “Now I’m even more delighted and satisfied with the Buddha, since he tells me to act after careful consideration.

an8.12:26.3.pli: Mañhi, bhante, aññatitthiyā sāvakaṃ labhitvā kevalakappaṃ vesāliṃ paṭākaṃ parihareyyuṃ:
an8.12:26.3.eng: For if the followers of other religions were to gain me as a disciple, they’d carry a banner all over Vesālī, saying:

an8.12:26.5.pli: Atha ca pana bhagavā evamāha: ‘anuviccakāraṃ, sīha, karohi. Anuviccakāro tumhādisānaṃ ñātamanussānaṃ sādhu hotī’ti.
an8.12:26.5.eng: And yet the Buddha tells me to act after careful consideration.

an8.12:26.6.pli: Esāhaṃ, bhante, dutiyampi bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
an8.12:26.6.eng: For a second time, I go for refuge to the Buddha, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

an8.12:26.7.pli: Upāsakaṃ maṃ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
an8.12:26.7.eng: From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

an8.12:27.1.pli: “Dīgharattaṃ kho te, sīha, nigaṇṭhānaṃ opānabhūtaṃ kulaṃ, yena nesaṃ upagatānaṃ piṇḍakaṃ dātabbaṃ maññeyyāsī”ti.
an8.12:27.1.eng: “For a long time now, Sīha, your family has been a well-spring of support for the Jain ascetics. You should consider giving to them when they come.”

an8.12:27.2.pli: “Imināpāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato bhiyyoso mattāya attamano abhiraddho, yaṃ maṃ bhagavā evamāha:
an8.12:27.2.eng: “Now I’m even more delighted and satisfied with the Buddha, since he tells me to

an8.12:27.3.pli: ‘dīgharattaṃ kho te, sīha, nigaṇṭhānaṃ opānabhūtaṃ kulaṃ, yena nesaṃ upagatānaṃ piṇḍakaṃ dātabbaṃ maññeyyāsī’ti.
an8.12:27.3.eng: consider giving to the Jain ascetics when they come.

an8.12:27.6.pli: mayhameva dānaṃ dātabbaṃ, mayhameva sāvakānaṃ dātabbaṃ;
an8.12:27.6.eng: ‘Gifts should only be given to me, and to my disciples.

an8.12:27.7.pli: mayhameva dinnaṃ mahapphalaṃ, na aññesaṃ dinnaṃ mahapphalaṃ;
an8.12:27.7.eng: Only what is given to me is very fruitful, not what is given to others.

an8.12:27.8.pli: mayhameva sāvakānaṃ dinnaṃ mahapphalaṃ, na aññesaṃ sāvakānaṃ dinnaṃ mahapphalan’ti,
an8.12:27.8.eng: Only what is given to my disciples is very fruitful, not what is given to the disciples of others.’

an8.12:27.9.pli: atha ca pana maṃ bhagavā nigaṇṭhesupi dāne samādapeti.
an8.12:27.9.eng: Yet the Buddha encourages me to give to the Jain ascetics.

an8.12:27.10.pli: Api ca, bhante, mayamettha kālaṃ jānissāma.
an8.12:27.10.eng: Well, sir, we’ll know the proper time for that.

an8.12:27.11.pli: Esāhaṃ, bhante, tatiyampi bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
an8.12:27.11.eng: For a third time, I go for refuge to the Buddha, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

an8.12:27.12.pli: Upāsakaṃ maṃ, bhante, bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
an8.12:27.12.eng: From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

an8.12:28.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sīhassa senāpatissa anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyathidaṃ—
an8.12:28.1.eng: Then the Buddha taught Sīha step by step, with

an8.12:28.2.pli: dānakathaṃ sīlakathaṃ saggakathaṃ, kāmānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṅkilesaṃ nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ pakāsesi.
an8.12:28.2.eng: a talk on giving, ethical conduct, and heaven. He explained the drawbacks of sensual pleasures, so sordid and corrupt, and the benefit of renunciation.

an8.12:28.3.pli: Yadā bhagavā aññāsi sīhaṃ senāpatiṃ kallacittaṃ muducittaṃ vinīvaraṇacittaṃ udaggacittaṃ pasannacittaṃ, atha yā buddhānaṃ sāmukkaṃsikā dhammadesanā taṃ pakāsesi—
an8.12:28.3.eng: And when the Buddha knew that Sīha’s mind was ready, pliable, rid of hindrances, elated, and confident he explained the special teaching of the Buddhas:

an8.12:28.4.eng: suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.

an8.12:28.5.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ sammadeva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya;
an8.12:28.5.eng: Just as a clean cloth rid of stains would properly absorb dye,

an8.12:28.6.pli: evamevaṃ sīhassa senāpatissa tasmiṃyeva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi:
an8.12:28.6.eng: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma arose in General Sīha:

an8.12:28.7.eng: “Everything that has a beginning has an end.”

an8.12:29.1.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṅkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an8.12:29.1.eng: Then Sīha saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the Dhamma. He went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. He said to the Buddha,

an8.12:29.2.pli: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
an8.12:29.2.eng: “Sir, may the Buddha together with the mendicant Saṅgha please accept tomorrow’s meal from me.”

an8.12:29.4.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
an8.12:29.4.eng: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, Sīha got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.

an8.12:30.1.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati aññataraṃ purisaṃ āmantesi:
an8.12:30.1.eng: Then Sīha addressed a certain man,

an8.12:30.2.eng: “Worthy, please find out if there is any meat ready for sale.”

an8.12:30.3.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi:
an8.12:30.3.eng: And when the night had passed General Sīha had delicious fresh and cooked foods prepared in his own home. Then he had the Buddha informed of the time, saying,

an8.12:30.4.eng: “Sir, it’s time. The meal is ready.”

an8.12:31.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sīhassa senāpatissa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
an8.12:31.1.eng: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to Sīha’s home, where he sat on the seat spread out, together with the Saṅgha of mendicants.

an8.12:31.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā nigaṇṭhā vesāliyaṃ rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ bāhā paggayha kandanti:
an8.12:31.2.eng: Now at that time many Jain ascetics in Vesālī went from street to street and from square to square, calling out with raised arms:

an8.12:31.3.pli: “ajja sīhena senāpatinā thūlaṃ pasuṃ vadhitvā samaṇassa gotamassa bhattaṃ kataṃ.
an8.12:31.3.eng: “Today General Sīha has slaughtered a fat calf for the ascetic Gotama’s meal.

an8.12:31.4.pli: Taṃ samaṇo gotamo jānaṃ uddissakataṃ maṃsaṃ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman”ti.
an8.12:31.4.eng: The ascetic Gotama knowingly eats meat prepared specially for him: this is a deed he caused.”

an8.12:32.1.pli: Atha kho aññataro puriso yena sīho senāpati tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā sīhassa senāpatissa upakaṇṇake ārocesi:
an8.12:32.1.eng: Then a certain person went up to Sīha and whispered in his ear,

an8.12:32.3.pli: Ete sambahulā nigaṇṭhā vesāliyaṃ rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ bāhā paggayha kandanti:
an8.12:32.3.eng: Many Jain ascetics in Vesālī are going from street to street and square to square, calling out with raised arms:

an8.12:32.4.pli: ‘ajja sīhena senāpatinā thūlaṃ pasuṃ vadhitvā samaṇassa gotamassa bhattaṃ kataṃ.
an8.12:32.4.eng: ‘Today General Sīha has slaughtered a fat calf for the ascetic Gotama’s meal.

an8.12:32.5.pli: Taṃ samaṇo gotamo jānaṃ uddissakataṃ maṃsaṃ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman’ti.
an8.12:32.5.eng: The ascetic Gotama knowingly eats meat prepared specially for him: this is a deed he caused.’”

an8.12:32.6.pli: Alaṃ ayyo dīgharattañhi te āyasmanto avaṇṇakāmā buddhassa avaṇṇakāmā dhammassa avaṇṇakāmā saṅghassa.
an8.12:32.6.eng: “Enough, master. For a long time those venerables have wanted to discredit the Buddha, his teaching, and his Saṅgha.

an8.12:32.7.pli: Na ca panete āyasmanto jiridanti taṃ bhagavantaṃ asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhituṃ;
an8.12:32.7.eng: They’ll never stop misrepresenting the Buddha with their incorrect, hollow, false, untruthful claims.

an8.12:32.8.pli: na ca mayaṃ jīvitahetupi sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropeyyāmā”ti.
an8.12:32.8.eng: We would never deliberately take the life of a living creature, not even for life’s sake.”

an8.12:33.1.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi.
an8.12:33.1.eng: Then Sīha served and satisfied the mendicant Saṅgha headed by the Buddha with his own hands with delicious fresh and cooked foods.

an8.12:33.2.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
an8.12:33.2.eng: When the Buddha had eaten and washed his hand and bowl, Sīha sat down to one side.

an8.12:33.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho sīhaṃ senāpatiṃ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmīti.
an8.12:33.3.eng: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired him with a Dhamma talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.

an8.120:1.1.eng: “For insight into greed, eight things should be developed.

an8.120:1.3.pli: Rūpī rūpāni passati, ajjhattaṃ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati, subhanteva adhimutto hoti, sabbaso rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṃ atthaṅgamā nānattasaññānaṃ amanasikārā ‘ananto ākāso’ti ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ upasampajja viharati, sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ samatikkamma ‘anantaṃ viññāṇan’ti viññāṇañcāyatanaṃ upasampajja viharati, sabbaso viññāṇañcāyatanaṃ samatikkamma ‘natthi kiñcī’ti ākiñcaññāyatanaṃ upasampajja viharati, sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṃ samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ upasampajja viharati, sabbaso nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ samatikkamma saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ upasampajja viharati—
an8.120:1.3.eng: Having physical form, they see forms … not perceiving form internally, they see forms externally … they’re focused only on beauty … going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the disappearance of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite space … going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite consciousness … going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they enter and remain in the dimension of nothingness … going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, they enter and remain in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception … going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, they enter and remain in the cessation of perception and feeling …

an8.120:1.4.pli: rāgassa, bhikkhave, abhiññāya ime aṭṭha dhammā bhāvetabbā”.
an8.120:1.4.eng: For insight into greed, these eight things should be developed.”

an8.121-147:1.10.eng: these eight things should be developed.”
